snippet: Representative Paul D. Ryan’s committee is at the junction where the White House and Republican agendas overlap — trade, taxes and possibly health care.
abstract: Rep Paul D Ryan, staunch conservative and foil to Pres Obama's legislative agenda, finds himself unlikely advocate of compromise in his position as chairman of House Ways and Means Committee; Ryan, focused on achieving tangible results, is attempting to strike deal with Democrats on trade, taxes and healthcare that is palatable to Republicans.
lead_paragraph: Representative Paul D. Ryan’s committee is at the junction where the White House and Republican agendas overlap — trade, taxes and possibly health care.

headline.main: Paul Ryan Finds New, Unlikely Role as Gatekeeper of Obama’s Agenda
headline.print_headline: G.O.P.’s Ryan Finds Novel Role as Arbiter of Obama’s Agenda

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: House Committee on Ways and Means
